instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: cant find serial bios dump 820-2850
threads.message:
hi i replaced the mainboard for a client and i want to enter him the same serial in the bios file.

in the 2011 machines its easy to find just looking for "ssn"

in the 2010 device i cant find it, is it coded?

threads.title: cant find serial bios dump 820-2850
threads.message:
File: [URL]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1V8yLO-19G3wXIXjo8sIaIJ2FxcM0sEni/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

this is the original bios file and in the pic the original serial and mlb

i dont find the sn in the bios file. i want to replace it with another one

threads.title: cant find serial bios dump 820-2850
threads.message: Dump is incorrect, only 128kiB, probably selected wrong chip in programmer software.

threads.title: cant find serial bios dump 820-2850
threads.message:
Supposedlly, your programmer didn't recognize the SPI chip correctly.
It is 8MB (64Mb) in size.
Clean its pins and try to read it again.

threads.title: cant find serial bios dump 820-2850
threads.message: thanks thats it, found now everything.
